title: 105_s2616
content:
The Act titled "Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998" revises payment limits for home health services under the Medicare program. The Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998 revises per beneficiary limits for home health agencies, ensuring payment does not exceed determined costs or a product of applicable limits and patient count. The Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998 sets agency-specific per beneficiary annual limitations based on reasonable costs and standardized regional averages, updated by the home health market basket index. For cost reporting periods after October 1, 1998, not under the prospective payment system, the limit is calculated based on the agency's previous limit and national mean. The Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998 establishes agency-specific annual limitations based on reasonable costs and standardized regional averages, updated by the home health market basket index. The limits are calculated based on the national mean and regional averages, with adjustments for subsequent fiscal years. The Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998 sets agency-specific annual limits on costs, updated by the home health market basket index. Limits are based on national mean and regional averages, with adjustments for subsequent fiscal years. Amendments include changes to percentage references and revisions to per visit limits. The Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998 amends the Social Security Act to delay the implementation of the prospective payment system for home health services by one year. It also adjusts the annual cost limits based on national mean and regional averages, with changes to percentage references and per visit limits. The Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998 delays the implementation of the prospective payment system for home health services by one year and adjusts annual cost limits based on national mean and regional averages. The Balanced Budget Act of 1997 is amended to change effective dates and contingency reductions. Additionally, the Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998 delays the implementation of the prospective payment system for home health services by one year and adjusts annual cost limits based on national mean and regional averages. The Balanced Budget Act of 1997 amendments include changes to effective dates and contingency reductions for cost reporting periods starting in fiscal years 2000, 2001, and 2004. The Medicare Home Health Fair Payment Act of 1998 delays the prospective payment system for home health services by one year and adjusts annual cost limits based on national mean and regional averages, effective from October 1, 1998 onwards. SEC. 3. CLARIFICATION AND EXPANSION OF MATHEMATICAL ERROR ASSESSMENT PROCEDURES. (a) TIN Deemed Incorrect if Information on Return Differs With Agency Records.--Section 6213(g)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to treat a taxpayer as having omitted a correct TIN if the information provided on the return differs from the information obtained by the Secretary from the issuer of the TIN. 
(b) Expansion of Mathematical Error Procedures to Cases Where TIN Establishes Individual Not Eligible for Tax Credit.--Section 6213(g)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include cases where the TIN establishes that an individual is not eligible for a tax credit. The amendment includes the addition of a new subparagraph (L) regarding the inclusion of a TIN on a return for certain tax credits based on the individual's age. The effective date for these amendments is specified. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4 amends the Internal Revenue Code to include rotavirus gastroenteritis vaccine as a taxable vaccine. The amendment applies to sales after the enactment date. SEC. 5 clarifies the definition of specified liability loss. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code defines specified liability loss as any deductible amount related to land reclamation, nuclear plant decommissioning, offshore platform dismantlement, environmental remediation, or workmen's compensation under federal or state law. The amendment made by this section applies to net operating losses for taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act, with the specified liability loss defined as deductible amounts related to various activities. SEC. 6 amends section 448(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to limit required accrual of amounts received for personal services in specific fields. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 1998 and includes provisions for changing accounting methods with a 3-year adjustment period. SEC. 7 amends section 6050P(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include organizations whose significant trade is lending money in reporting requirements for cancellations of indebtedness. Effective for discharges of indebtedness after December 31, 1998.
